alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 12 at 4:01AM MDT until April 14 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: .Warm temperatures may melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following areas, Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine, Eastern Toole and Liberty, Hill County and Northern Blaine County. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Northern Blaine County
